summary: Ever get tired of holding onto heaping piles of loot just because you can't find a merchant with enough gold left to buy it? ... Not too picky about lore or the game's economy? Then this mod is for you!
descriptionHtml:
*This mod is now out-of-date. I have, more or less, merged it with my [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58065/?]Teleporter Mod[/url].*

------------------------------------------------------------------------
|                 Darkxenoth's Gold Conversion Mod                    |
------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------
|Description|
----------------
Ever get tired of holding onto heaping piles of loot just because you can't find a merchant with enough gold
left to buy it? Tired of having a chest full of unwanted stuff you've collected, but couldn't get rid of and
so just threw it in a random chest to get it out of your inventory? Not too picky about lore or the game's
economy? Then this mod is for you!
This mod adds a Converter Skull to the player's inventory on the first time you load after adding it to your
load order. You use this skull to gain access to a custom room that contains the mighty Conversion Chest!
This chest will allow you to put any items that you may have collected along your journey that:
-You can't be bothered to find a merchant to sell to
-You can't sell to merchants due to their lack of funds
-Whatever reason you want really...
-!!FAIR WARNING!! Don't put anything in the chest that you want to keep - JUST DON'T!
After adding the items to the chest and closing it, wait a second and a message will appear telling you how
much gold the items that were in the chest were worth*. After you get the message, collect your gold from the
chest. To get back from whence you came, simply reactivate the Converter Skull**.
* Something to note is that you won't get the full value of some items, especially enchanted weapons/armor.
  This is due to the fact that it calculates the value of items based on their base, non/un-enchanted, forms.
  
** After you activate the skull, close your inventory and the menu will come up. The menu options are
   explained on-screen with the prompt.
   
----------------
|Installation|
----------------
|Requirements|
-------------------
Up-To-Date Skyrim -That's it!
-----------------------------------
Installation is fairly simple whether you use a mod installer such as NMM or Mod Organizer, or through manual
installation.
|NMM Installation|
----------------------
Use the "Download with Manager" button on the Skyrim Nexus page.
Then simply activate it in NMM.
|Manual Installation|
-------------------------
Extract the contents of the included Skyrim folder to your Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim
 -Example: C:\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim
 -There shouldn't be anything that needs overwriting, unless another of your mods has files with conflicting
  file names.
 -Files included are: ConverterSkull.esp, AddConverterSkull.pex, ConversionChestScript.pex,
                              ConverterSkullScript.pex, AddConverterSkull.psc, ConversionChestScript.psc, and
                              ConverterSkullScript.psc
As a final installation note - It is always good practice to run LOOT after adding any mod to your load order
                                          Load order shouldn't make a difference for this.
-------------------
|Uninstallation|
-------------------
It shouldn't make a difference when you uninstall this mod so long as you make sure you aren't in the
custom room/cell where the chest is when you uninstall.
|Uninstalling with NMM|
-----------------------------
Simply deactivate the mod in NMM
|Manual Uninstall|
----------------------
Remove ConverterSkull.esp from your Skyrim\Data folder
Remove AddConverterSkull.psc, ConverterSkullScript.psc and ConversionChestScript.psc from your
       Skyrim\Data\Scripts\Source folder
Remove AddConverterSkull.pex, ConverterSkullScript.pex and ConversionChestScript.pex from your
       Skyrim\Data\Scripts folder


--------------------

files.changelogHtml:
v1.1 - Fixed some bugs/issues that were brought to my attention and replicated
-After converting an item/items to gold, if you took the gold and added more items without
closing the chest, the gold value would go negative and thus result in nothing being in the
chest after you closed it.
-If you didn't take the gold from the chest before closing it again, after having converted
item(s), the gold would be removed.*
(*Note: the fix implemented for this might make it so your items don't get converted when you close the chest. If this happens, just add another item or take an item out and it should fix the problem... This is due to it not converting the contents of the chest if the item count and gold value are equal.)
